SARS-CoV-2 may cause stroke by several mechanisms: invasion of vessel walls, coagulation disorders, cerebral embolism secondary to myocardial damage, or destabilisation of an existing atheromatous plaque. The virus is able to invade vessel walls because endothelial cells express the ACE2 receptor, which the virus uses to enter cells; SARS-CoV-2 has been detected in the endothelium.
27 When it invades vessel walls, it may behave similarly to the varicella zoster virus, the most frequent viral cause of stroke, triggering inflammation and even necrosis of the walls of cerebral arteries.
